## Type of Change

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Documentation update only
- [ ] Refactoring (non-breaking change that improves code quality)
- [ ] Performance improvement (non-breaking change that improves performance)
- [ ] Security improvement (non-breaking change that improves security)

## Code Review Checklist

### Code Quality:

- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines
- [ ] Code is properly commented
- [ ] Code is self-documenting where possible
- [ ] Code is efficient and performant
- [ ] Code is secure and follows security best practices
- [ ] Error handling is appropriate
- [ ] Logging is appropriate
- [ ] Configuration is externalized where appropriate

### Documentation Quality:

- [ ] Documentation is accurate and up-to-date
- [ ] Documentation is clear and concise
- [ ] Documentation includes examples where appropriate
- [ ] Documentation follows style guidelines
- [ ] Documentation includes troubleshooting information
- [ ] Documentation includes performance considerations
- [ ] Documentation includes security considerations

### Testing Quality:

- [ ] Tests are comprehensive and cover edge cases
- [ ] Tests are maintainable and readable
- [ ] Tests are efficient and performant
- [ ] Tests include appropriate assertions
- [ ] Tests include appropriate setup and teardown
- [ ] Tests include appropriate mocking where needed

## Security Considerations

- [ ] Code has been reviewed for security vulnerabilities
- [ ] Input validation is appropriate
- [ ] Output encoding is appropriate
- [ ] Authentication and authorization are appropriate
- [ ] Data encryption is appropriate
- [ ] Logging does not include sensitive information
- [ ] Error messages do not leak sensitive information
- [ ] Dependencies are secure and up-to-date

## Performance Considerations

- [ ] Code has been reviewed for performance issues
- [ ] Database queries are optimized
- [ ] Caching is appropriate
- [ ] Memory usage is appropriate
- [ ] CPU usage is appropriate
- [ ] Network usage is appropriate
- [ ] Scalability considerations have been addressed
- [ ] Monitoring and alerting are appropriate

## Deployment Considerations

- [ ] Deployment process is documented
- [ ] Rollback process is documented
- [ ] Configuration changes are documented
- [ ] Database changes are documented
- [ ] Environment variables are documented
- [ ] Dependencies are documented
- [ ] Monitoring and alerting are appropriate
- [ ] Health checks are appropriate

## Breaking Changes

If this PR includes breaking changes, please describe them below:

- [ ] Deprecation warnings added

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the style guidelines of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules
- [ ] I have checked the documentation for accuracy
- [ ] I have considered the security implications of my changes
- [ ] I have considered the performance implications of my changes
- [ ] I have considered the deployment implications of my changes
